channel.title: Cannot Burm New DVDs
channel.description: I recently bought a pack of 50 Memorex DVD + Rs. I am trying to burn an xbox iso image file using Ashampoo, and whenever I try to burn it above 2.4x, it wont work! It just says error, cannot burn disc. No specifics. It's wierd because I can copy dvds onto the dvd+rs, but can't burn directly onto them. Now, I know what your thinking, "He just needs updated firmware." Well, thats not it, because I have already updated it to its latest. By the way, my drive is a TSSTcorp CD/DVDW TS-H552B. Can you help me? EDIT: Look at this, its retarded; [img]http://img508.imageshack.us/img508/9092/drivedy2.png[/img] Why does it say dvd-r? WTH? I'm 100% positive my drive is DVD+/-RW and R. Its also a double layer drive, iif thats any consolation. It funcions as my cd and dvd drive.

item.title: Cannot Burm New DVDs
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

They are copyrighted. So you need a Dvd decryptor. Then you can copy them.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot Burm New DVDs
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Use Alcohol 120% and use DVD-R’s which are made so you can copy DVDs.

Oh and Ashampoo, will not plant image files as bootable. You need to use either Alcohol 120%, DVD Decryptor, or Nero to make the image bootable.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot Burm New DVDs
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

I think my brother had that (prolly not the same) problem and he couldnt play DVDs, try restarting it?

Read full topic
